Paul May

Design Research Talk at the Pratt Institute

04 February 2013

Tonight I’m visiting Visual Communication students at the Pratt Institute to give feedback on their assignment “Something Useful”. The students have been asked to: > Uncover, research, and visualize the innerworkings of a frequently used system that tends to go unnoticed.

It’s a cool assignment, and I am looking forward to seeing the students’ progress. I’ll also be giving a brief talk about doing research to inform a design project. Thanks to Pratt instructor Bobby Genalo for inviting me along.
